dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6594 IH: Protecting Federal Agencies and Employees from Political Interference Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Norton (for herself, Mr. Trone, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Mr. Raskin, and Mr. Brown of Maryland) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To require that the headquarters for any entity of the Federal Government located in the National Capital region shall remain in the National Capital region unless relocation legislation is enacted, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Federal Agencies and Employees from Political Interference Act of 2022.

section.header: Agency and department headquarters located in the National Capital region

subsection.text: The headquarters for any entity of the Federal Government located in the National Capital region on the date of introduction in the House of Representatives of this Act shall remain in the National Capital region unless legislation is enacted into law approving or otherwise providing for relocation.

Any employee position with a duty station in the National Capital region on the date of introduction in the House of Representatives of this Act shall remain stationed in the National Capital region unless legislation is enacted into law approving or otherwise providing for relocation.
